title: Frontier in Space
dialogue_triumphs: The Master: 'In reminiscent mood, are you, Doctor? Poor Miss Grant, you have my deepest sympathies.'
The Master calls the Daleks 'stupid tin boxes'.
goofs: Katy Manning's babbling in episode four seems improvised.
Jo splits her trousers while running to escape the Ogrons in episode three.
Jo's tights change colour from scene to scene (and occasionally she isn't wearing any at all).
Big strings hold the Doctor up for his spacewalk in episode six.
The Ogron monster is a big orange carrier-bag.
As the space-walking Doctor opens the airlock in episode four there is a technician visible inside it.

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's time and space machine
continuity_notes.current_status: Travels in hyperspace, helps the Doctor reach destinations when he knows exact coordinates

continuity_notes.name: Sonic Screwdriver
continuity_notes.current_status: Cannot undo bolts unless polarity is reversed, left on the moon

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.current_status: Immune to mind probes, carries a string file in his boot and a radio direction finder

continuity_notes.name: Jo Grant
continuity_notes.current_status: Does HQ filing, conditioned against hypnosis, fears Drashigs, Mutants, and Sea Devils

continuity_notes.name: Ogrons
continuity_notes.current_status: Worship 'The Monster', fear Daleks, carry neuronic stun guns

continuity_notes.name: The Master
continuity_notes.current_status: Knowledgeable about Earth poetry and song

continuity_notes.name: Daleks
continuity_notes.current_status: Led by a gold Dalek, recognize the Doctor, have an army ready at a base

continuity_notes.name: Draconians
continuity_notes.current_status: Have galaxy class battle cruisers, claim not to lie, follow strict social hierarchy

technobabble: The TARDIS telepathic circuits can be used by the Doctor to contact his people.
The sonic screwdriver can become an electromagnet when the polarity of the power source is reversed.
roots: Star Trek ('Balance of Terror' and 'Errand of Mercy')

locations.name: Earth
locations.current_status: Part of an expanding empire in the 26th century

locations.name: Draconia
locations.current_status: Part of an expanding empire in the 26th century

locations.name: Ogron planet
locations.current_status: Located on the remote fringes of the Milky Way galaxy

future_history: Set in 2540, at the start of Earth's empire. The Draconia/Earth war took place 20 years previously. Earth is ruled by a President with a complex political system. Interstellar travel is routine, and both Earth and Draconian Empires are expanding through the Milky Way galaxy. Some colonies have achieved dominion status.
untold_adventures: The Doctor was once captured by the Medusoids, hairy one-legged jellyfish
The Doctor aided the 15th Draconian Emperor 500 years ago in dealing with a plague from space
additional_notes: The episode features notable costume design, including the President's chunky shoes and the Earth military uniform with an interrogator in a silver evening gown and long dress gloves.
bottom_line: Worthy, very well directed and designed to the hilt with a solid costuming policy for both empires. However, it's obviously padded in parts.
